### Problem

CMake generation fails due to unescaped include argument to MSVC:
```
[137/144] Performing configure step for 'lpeg'
loading initial cache file D:/evil path/neovim/cmake-build-debug/.deps/build/tmp/lpeg-cache-Debug.cmake
-- The C compiler identification is MSVC 19.43.34808.0

-- Configuring done (0.5s)

FAILED: build/src/lpeg-stamp/lpeg-build D:/evil path/neovim/cmake-build-debug/.deps/build/src/lpeg-stamp/lpeg-build

[1/7] Building C object CMakeFiles\lpeg.dir\lpcap.c.obj
FAILED: CMakeFiles/lpeg.dir/lpcap.c.obj 
"C:\Program Files\CMake\bin\cmake.exe" -E env CCACHE_SLOPPINESS=pch_defines,time_macros C:/Lang/Strawberry/c/bin/ccache.exe C:\PROGRA~1\MICROS~1\2022\COMMUN~1\VC\Tools\MSVC\1443~1.348\bin\Hostx64\x64\cl.exe  /nologo   -ID:/evil path/neovim/cmake-build-debug/.deps/usr/include -ID:/evil path/neovim/cmake-build-debug/.deps/usr/include/luajit-2.1 /Zi /Ob0 /Od /RTC1 -MDd -w /showIncludes /FoCMakeFiles\lpeg.dir\lpcap.c.obj /FdCMakeFiles\lpeg.dir\lpeg.pdb /FS -c "D:\evil path\neovim\cmake-build-debug\.deps\build\src\lpeg\lpcap.c"
cl : Command line warning D9024 : unrecognized source file type 'path/neovim/cmake-build-debug/.deps/usr/include', object file assumed

cl : Command line warning D9024 : unrecognized source file type 'path/neovim/cmake-build-debug/.deps/usr/include/luajit-2.1', object file assumed
cl : Command line warning D9027 : source file 'path/neovim/cmake-build-debug/.deps/usr/include/luajit-2.1' ignored
D:\evil path\neovim\cmake-build-debug\.deps\build\src\lpeg\lpcap.c(2): fatal error C1083: Cannot open include file: 'lua.h': No such file or directory
```

Part of CMakeCache for lpeg build:
```
//Flags used by the C compiler during all build types.
CMAKE_C_FLAGS:STRING=-ID:/evil path/neovim/cmake-build-debug/.deps/usr/include -ID:/evil path/neovim/cmake-build-debug/.deps/usr/include/luajit-2.1
```

Culprit seems to be this:
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/614c9322d50052c76fb3e6e1be7536a972ff0902/cmake.deps/CMakeLists.txt#L76
Escaping those results in successful generation.

A quick project wide search after `-I$` finds 4 locations. And that's only `-I`.
I would guess that in most scenarios, CMake provides appropiate higher level mechanisms like `include_directories`.

### Steps to reproduce

Clone into directory containing a space
Do CMake generation that uses MSVC
-> Generation fails

### Expected behavior

CMake generation should succeed even if the repo path contains spaces

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

master

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

-

### Operating system/version

Windows 11
